title: Inside the Debacle That Led to the Closure of El Paso’s Airspace
summary: The F.A.A., citing “a grave risk of fatalities” from a new technology being used on the Mexican border, got caught in a stalemate with the Pentagon, which deemed the weapon “necessary.”

title: Department of Homeland Security Shuts Down, Though Essential Work Continues
summary: Though funding for the department ran out early Saturday, officials said its essential functions would continue.

title: T.S.A. Workers Brace for Another Shutdown They Didn’t Cause
summary: As Congress leaves town without funding their department, airport security officers wonder, “How many more times am I going to be able to do this?”

title: How ICE Failed to Justify the Shooting of Julio Sosa-Celis in Minneapolis
summary: The collapse of the Trump administration’s version of events in the case was only the most recent instance in which officials gave an account of a shooting that was later contradicted.

title: Homeland Security Demands Social Media Sites Reveal Names Behind Anti-ICE Posts
summary: The department has sent Google, Meta and other companies hundreds of subpoenas for information on accounts that track or comment on Immigration and Customs Enforcement, officials and tech workers said.

title: Sick Detainees Describe Poor Care at CoreCivic ICE Facilities
summary: Problems at detention centers operated by CoreCivic extend far beyond recent measles outbreaks.

title: Olympic Figure Skating Is a Young Woman’s Sport. Deanna Stellato-Dudek Wants to Change That.
summary: Deanna Stellato-Dudek, a Canadian pairs skater, is trying to make history at the Olympics — despite a training accident a week before the Games.

title: Their Secret to a Happy Marriage? A Translation App
summary: He speaks English. She speaks Mandarin. The secret to their happy marriage: Microsoft Translator.

title: Bondi’s Incompetence Is the Latest Insult for Epstein’s Victims
summary: The attorney general’s behavior reveals a deeper rot in the American justice system.

title: Pam Bondi’s ‘Cage Match’ and Trump’s Fraying Coalition
summary: The round table reflects on a chaotic week of incompetence and meltdowns.

title: Open Road
summary: On Valentine’s Day, consider the ways in which we’re sticking to established paths — and the places where we yearn to deviate.

title: Casey Wasserman Will Sell Entertainment Agency Amid Epstein Files Fallout
summary: Casey Wasserman, a Los Angeles entertainment executive and the head of the 2028 Olympic Games, has lost clients since his emails with Ghislaine Maxwell surfaced.

title: Harris Sold Email List to D.N.C., Then Paid Off 2024 Debts
summary: The national party, which is nearly $100 million behind its G.O.P. counterpart, bought the list for $6.5 million.

title: Floods. Smoke. Soaring Bills. Mamdani’s Climate Czar Has a Full Agenda.
summary: Louise Yeung relishes the intricacies of policy debates and the magic of rom-coms. She lives in Brooklyn with her cat and two snails.

title: Florida Couple Arrested After Pickleball Match Turns Into a Brawl
summary: The couple, who were banned for life from a country club in Port Orange, Fla., face felony battery charges after the fight, which involved 20 people, the authorities said.
